intro: Physaloides prostrata, commonly known as the prostrate physalid, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Solanaceae. It is a low-growing, herbaceous species characterized by its trailing stems and small, hairy leaves. The plant produces clusters of yellow flowers that are typically followed by distinctive, inflated, green to yellow berries. It is native to regions of South America, particularly Argentina and Chile, and thrives in moist, temperate climates. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain environments.
